reviews.review_msg: Definitely one of the best!  He's so sweet and funny, but if you're lazy, the course is structured so that you really don't have to go to class for the last several weeks.
No Comments

Broc is hilarious, honestly 18th century lit does not sound like a particularly riveting class, and the readings are long, difficult, and numerous but I live for his lectures. The only thing to keep in mind when taking English 205 is that attendance is compulsory both in lecture and tutorial- so not a class for someone who likes to ditch.

I love her! She is one of my favourite professors at SFU! I've actually had her for two classes now and am looking at taking another one with her next semester. She is really nice and she is really helpful. She tries so hard to make it interesting for students and she gives great feedback.

I love her! She is so excited about the subject and tries really hard to get class engaged. She brings props, puts on videos and brought in singers. She is always willing to help if you go see her during office hours and she gives mock exams before midterm and final to help you study.

A very engaging prof. I'd say one of the best english teachers in SFU with her clairity and overall interest in her job and students. I liked how she encouraged questions and thoughts in class. Notes were well organized - not too fast and not too much. The way she talks makes me giggle a bit though.

She really cares about her student's success in class. Consider yourself lucky for Leith, there are a lot worse professors at SFU that pale in comparison to Leith. Save your complaints for the upper level engl profs. She's not a hard marker either.

His lectures were very long, and a night class, but he cares so much about his students that it almost forgives that. His lectures are quite dry, but the material is really interesting, and he gives you so much feedback, plus, he's a decent marker. He is a nice person, and honestly wants his student's input and response!
Michael Everton is the sexiest professor of all time.

Betty does not use Canvas or any technology, it's all done on a projector during lectures. Her midterms and exams are more history-based than literary based. A lot of her assignments are fit for 3rd or 4th years, not 2nd year classes.

I took this class because nothing else fit into my schedule. Overall I found the class quite boring and the lectures droned on. Following Betty's lecture notes was confusing because she was all over the place. I also found her intimidating and judgemental which caused me to refrain from participating in class.

She is a nice lady. Her office hour is quite useful if you have any questions with essays. She will give you useful suggestions on essays. The midterm is not that hard, but the final exam and the second essay are difficult. Get ready to read.

I really enjoyed this course. Betty chose a wide range of readings that kept lectures interesting. The grading criteria is clear, and the Midterm and Final are fair (based on materials talked about in lecture). Paper topics were interesting to write about. Overall, if you do the readings, and attend lecture/tutorial, you will do just fine.

Lots of material, expects a TON of background historical knowledge before start.  Midterm was *hard*, tested historical dates almost more than lit. Good intentions, but intimidating. Lots of 4th yrs took it so prof & my TA assumed everyone was 4th yr.Awesome lecturer. Wouldn't reccomend S for a Survey class. (not my TA, maybe better if she is TA?)

Nice, knowledgable, willing to listen.  Midterm was difficult-requires close analysis and the history part was  a surprise of historical stuff that was new to the class.  Like most English major people, she is finicky.
Awful... history lessons with no explanations of the work. For an intro course she expects a much higher understanding of the work than most students had. Boring. Nice lady though.
Worst English prof i've had. Do not take her if you have any ideas of your own. She only like students who spew back the crap she says in lecture.

She seems like a nice lady, and she's not a bad prof - she's just not great. The reading list was okay, the midterm was fair, but the essay topics are a bit vague. I sometimes felt as though I was in a history class instead of an english class.
No Comments
worst class i ever took. more boring than a stats class.
wacked out teacher. talks about history more than english. sheesh!  not very nice either.
I didn't even study for midterm and got B--classmates were lazy and annoying
midterm so difficult that ta's had trouble with it
like some else wrote here, I'm still waiting for a good lecture on Milton. Its his thing, right? And enough with the politics. I signed up for literature.     Does appear fond of himself.
He is very intelligent, but sometimes has trouble explaining things. Often assumes students know things they don't. An enthusiastic lecturer who made the content interesting!
Prof. Fleming entertained us with a spirited take on difficult material.  But unlike Budra, he didn't let the conversation become mindless.  A picky marker is a good thing, by the way.

I got an A in his course, but I still didn't like him very much -- I thought he was kind of stuck up and disorganized.
 Also, he's supposed to be a big expert on Milton, and I was looking forward to his lecture on Paradise lost but, he got a TA to substit
No Comments

He is super nice, understanding of personal issues that might prevent on time papers. He is fun and entertaining and able to laugh. He loves Tim Horton's, and people who can talk about the material. Loves to allow students to act or discuss material freely, very approachable and my favourite!
A very helpful instructor.  Passionate about his work, and in the progress of his students.  Humourous, and class is interesting.  Knowledgable, and willing to help through office hours and E-mail.
Lectures are pretty dry, and grading is tough, but so long as you actually put in the effort, you should get a decent grade. Nicky makes time for extra help, whether it's by email or after class.

Believes in student-centered learning, meaning she doesn't really teach anything. Knowledgeable if you have questions and ask her face-to-face, but teaches lectures by asking "So what did everybody think?" - not exactly helpful. Fair marking scheme but essay topics are terrible (stuff along the lines of "Who would you cast in a film adaptation?")

Nicki's grading scheme is amazing, allowing me to follow my own particular interests and get one hell of a good grade! The "dramatic readings" were a waste of my time (and some of them were just gawd awful!) I did NOT like how the lectures would digress into discussions - that's ok for an upper-level 2 hr seminar, but not a lower-level 1 hr lecture

With the grading scheme as it is, its impossible to actually get a grade out of the class that you can value.  Sure you can walk away with an A but compared to what exactly if no one else has the same assignments, grade weights or requirements.  Made the material interesting though I'll give her that.

Some fanciful activities are fun and educational -- those of Nicky Didicher are neither. Her tutorials are childish to the point of cruelty. You will be forced to compose poetry and letters to your classmates. She will mock your aspirations, then cackle over the remains of your spirit. Be warned.
Paul made me appreciate early modern literature. That is a feat I never would have thought possible a year ago.

Dr. Solomon is extremely clear in what she expects while also being fair in every situation. Her lectures were interesting both in their content and the form by which she presented them. In almost everyway she was giving us tools to learn from. I was not necessarily looking forward to this course, but I found a lot of enjoyment because of her.

Amazing professor. Her lectures are engaging and highly entertaining as she manages to infuse humor in all that she teaches. The texts themselves were very enjoyable reads, and also immensely funny. The most enjoyable class I've taken, the TA was also extremely helpful. If you can only take ONE English course, make sure it's one she is teaching.

Loved this prof and loved the class! I finished off my last 200-level credit with her and I already can't wait to take a 400-level with her. She gives clear, fair feedback. The exams were the easiest part of the course as long as you showed up to lecture and studied. Overall an enjoyable class with a great prof who is approachable and friendly :)

Simply put Professor Solomon is cute as a button! She is so passionate about the restoration and 18th century that it is infectious and you can't help but enjoy her lectures even if the subject area isn't your forte.

I LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this prof. SHE IS AWESOME. SO AWESOME. I did not know whether or not I would like the time period that we were studying, but I solely love it because of her. She is refreshing, straight-forward and engaging. She loves what she talks about and she really shows it in her clear voice. This is my favourite class so far. Take this one

I can honestly say she's the best English prof I've ever had. Knowledgeable, passionate, helpful, engaging, and a fair marker. For the final exam she tells you exactly what you need to study for, so there are no tricks/surprises with her. Definitely reccommend taking a class with her.

Great Prof, knows what she is doing. One of the few classes i didn't find myself falling asleep in. She's very clear with her assignments, and the exam is structured very fairly. TA Creel was awesome too. Great class, great prof, definitely recommend it!!!!
Took her as a TA, she was great, super interested in course content, and gives detailed feedback on assignments. I would definitely take another class with her again.
plays favourites ... it is true he'll make time for you anytime. It may help if you're pretty
